page.title: 12Farms. 2
page.content: {Fen Farm}is no longer a farm. Its land has all been sold. Now it consists of some old barns and a house.{Brickhouse {Farm}is rented by Mr. Kettley who manages four farms. At Higham Hall he grows wheat, barley and beans on 20 acres. At Brickhouse Farm he works 108 acres. He has 1200 sheep and breeds cattle and fattens them. He keeps other animals,like pigs,but they only eat scraps. At Westhouse Farm there are 500 acres for grazing. He has 8 barns and owns 4 tractors, 1 combine and 1 round-baler, which processes, silage, straw and hay. Each hay-bale weighs about 200kg. He has to stack the 2000 bales of hay which he grows himself. This farm has been in the family since 1960. Mr. Kettley rents Brickhouse Farm and Higham Hall, but he owns Pigett and Branford Farms. 5 people work at the 4 farms.
